info.name: PingID SDK - Sample Calls
info.description:
This is a collection of calls that can be made to perform MFA events with the PingID SDK service.

Tokens and Secrets should be placed into an Environment - the calls will pull from there.

All calls to the service require the proper Authorization token - the Collection has a pre-request script that will generate that for any call within it.

item.name: User Management

request.description:
Creates a User object in the PingID SDK service

Status: "NON_ACTIVE" because no devices have been associated with the user at this point.

Retrieves the User on the PingID ADK Account.

status: "UNKNOWN" because the object is not associated with a particular Application

A User can be associated with mutiple apps for the customer - the {{appId}} will tell you if the User is enrolled into it.

Retrieves the User for the PingID SDK Application.

Status: value reflects if the User has an enrolled device for this application.

Retrieves the User on the PingID ADK Account.

status: value is accurate

Call expands the devices & seenDevices without needing separate calls to retrieve them
Deletes the User from PingID SDK - this includes any enrolled devices

item.description:
Calls to handle User Enrollement.

Note: Adding a User does not include adding their Device - the User object needs to be created first, with whatever identifier you consider appropriate (I prefer an Immutable ID instead of username or email address).

item.name: Email Templates

request.description: Retrieves emailTemplate objects for an Application

item.name: SDK - Create Email Template (Custom - Pairing Example)

body.raw:
{ "fromAddress": "noreply@pingidentity.com", "emailSubject": "New Pairing", "emailBody": "A request to Pair a device has been made.

Please use this code to authorize the enrollment - ${OTP}", "replyToAddress": "noreply@pingidentity.com", "type": "pairing_request_postman_test" }

request.description: Creates an emailTemplate for a custom type
Creates an emailTemplate for "auth_without_payload" that is used by the PingFed SDK Adapter

item.description:
Sample calls for managing emailTemplate objects

emailTemplates can be fully customized and contain HTML. Custom values can be passed into the templates as part of the Authentication calls that use the templates.

item.name: Device Enrollment
Automatic Pairing

body.raw:
{
  "automaticPairing": true,
  "phoneNumber": "<<User SMS Number>>",
  "message": "Use this passcode to pair your SMS device - ",
  "sender": "",
  "deviceNickname": "My Text Device"
}

request.description: Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false

body.raw:
{
	"automaticPairing": true,
	"deviceNickname": "My Email Address",
	"locale": "en",
	"type": "<<Email Template Type>>",
	"recipient": "<<User Email Address>>",
	"emailParameters": "<<Optional Parameters - remove if not used>>"
}

request.description: Enrolls a Voice device for the User - automaticPairing: true

body.raw:
{
  "automaticPairing": true,
  "deviceNickname": "My Mobile Phone",
  "phoneNumber": "<<Your Voice Number>>",
  "message": "This is your code",
  "vendor": "Twilio",
  "voiceParameters": {},
  "voice": "Alice"
}

request.description: Enrolls a Voice device for the User - automaticPairing: true

item.description: Show calls that handle the device enrollment without needing a User intervention (i.e. enter an OTP)

item.name: Manual Pairing - SMS

body.raw:
{
  "automaticPairing": false,
  "phoneNumber": "<<User SMS Number>>",
  "message": "Use this passcode to add your SMS device - ",
  "sender": "",
  "deviceNickname": "My Text Device"
}

request.description: Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false
Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false
Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false

item.description:
Demonstrates sending a Pairing OTP to an SMS device, and the subsequent call needed to return and validate before adding the device to the User.

Other OTP methods (Email \ Voice) follow a similar pattern

item.name: Manual Pairing - Email

body.raw:
{
	"automaticPairing": false,
	"deviceNickname": "My Email Address",
	"locale": "en",
	"type": "<<Email Template Type>>",
	"recipient": "<<User Email Address>>",
	"emailParameters": "<<Optional Parameters for email - remove if not used>>"
}

request.description: Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false
Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false
Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false

item.description:
Demonstrates sending a Pairing OTP to an Email device, and the subsequent call needed to return and validate before adding the device to the User.

Other OTP methods (SMS \ Voice) follow a similar pattern

Note: Email transactions require an emailTemplate to have been created

item.name: Manual Pairing - Voice

body.raw:
{
  "automaticPairing": false,
  "deviceNickname": "My Mobile Phone",
  "phoneNumber": "<<Your Voice Number>>",
  "message": "This is your Pairing code",
  "vendor": "Twilio",
  "voiceParameters": {},
  "voice": "Alice"
}

request.description: Enrolls a SMS device for the User - automaticPairing: false

Demonstrates sending a Pairing OTP to an Voice device, and the subsequent call needed to return and validate before adding the device to the User.

Other OTP methods (SMS \ Email) follow a similar pattern

request.description: Direct call to retrieve just the User Devices
Set an Enrolled Device to "deviceRole: primary"
Remove device from User Account

item.description:
Sample calls to enroll (Pair) a device for the User in the Application.

These show both Automatic and Manual pairing flows for OTP-based (SMS \ Email \ Voice). 

Push Notification enrollment is handled by the Mobile SDK within the mobile app itself.

body.raw:
{
	"authenticationType": "AUTHENTICATE",
	"emailConfigurationType": "authentication",
	"smsMessage": "Please enter this code to authenticate - ",
	"pushMessageTitle": "Request from Customer Service",
	"pushMessageBody": "Please verify that you are ${usr}",
	"voiceMessage": "Your authentication code is: ${OTP}"
}

request.description:
This call sends an Authenticate request to whatever is the Primary device for the User, without needing to Get Devices in order to locate the deviceId.

All MFA methods are referenced in the body, with the SDK choosing the correct one.

item.name: Send OTP to Trusted Voice device

request.description:
Sends a Voice Authentication to the only Trusted Voice Device.

"deviceId" can be added to the payload to send to the specific device

item.name: Send OTP to Trusted Email device

request.description:
Sends a email to the Trusted email device - emailTemplate is sent according to "type"

"deviceId" can be added to the payload to send to the specific device

item.name: Send Custom Push to Trusted device

request.description:
Sends a Custom Push Authentication to the only Trusted Device

"deviceId" can be added to the payload to send to the specific device
Checks the status of an Authentication Request
Reqply with the OTP to an AuthN request

exec: // This script can be used to create the proper Authorization token needed for any call made to the PingID SDK service.
// The tenant secrets - sdkApiKey && sdkApiToken - should be defined in the Collection Environment.
// PM Variables can be used in the URL - this script will replace the following with corresponding values from the Environment:
// Get the Tenant Secrets from the environment (the values are in the pingidsdk.properties file)
// This checks for the body of the *Get Registration Token* call and pulls the payload value from the environment.
// Due to the way PM handles the request object, the URL Path needs to be rebuilt with the value substitution
// Hash and Hex Encode Request Payload
var canonicalString = method + ":" + "sdk.pingid.com" + ":" + "/" + path + ":" + parameters + ":" + payloadHex + ":";
// Set the token in the environment to be included in an Authorization: PINGID-HMAC={{authToken}} header for the request
